page.title: 18GARDENING IN CORBRIDGE
page.content: Corbridge inhabitants are down_to_ earth... literally.With some 1000 dedicated leisure gardeners,including upwards of 200 allotment holders.Most growers fanatically pay annual homage to the North East cult of growing massive leeks and competing with obsessive dedication in some 10 leeks club shows in the surrounding district for prize money in excess of 25,000 pounds a year raised by all_the_year_ round fund raising activity.In the elite Corbridge Leek Club,which incorporates the North of England giant onion show,the 1985 champion grew two prize specimens of 116 cubic inches and impressively dethroned the reigning champion.In 1985,80 holders of Cheynes allotments organised piped water to their gardens in the wettest summer for 20 years.
